step1-identity.title: Token identity

name.label: Name
name.info: Give the new token, you want to create, a descriptive/telling name.

symbol.label: Symbol
symbol.info: Choose a short symbol of 3-5 letters (numbers are allowed, too) for your new token. Please note, that the system rejects symbols that are already in use.

short-description.label: Short description
short-description.info: Describe the purpose/idea of your new token in a short version.

long-description.label: Long description
long-description.info: Describe the purpose/idea of your new token in a longer version.

step1-identity.info: The basic infos about this tokens identity.

step2-design.title: Token design

is-capped.label: is capped
is-capped.info: Once the total supply of this token reaches the cap, nobody (incl. the token creator) can mint this token anymore.

cap.label: Cap
cap.info: If the token is capped, this is the value of the cap.

initial-supply.label: Initial supply
initial-supply.info: The initial amount of this token that does not have to be earned via the claiming process. Counts into the total supply of this token. If a value bigger than 0 is set, an owner has to be chosen.

token-creator-owns-initial-supply.label: Token creator owns
token-creator-owns-initial-supply.info: If an initial supply is set, the token creator owns it.

other-initial-supply-owner.label: Owner address
other-initial-supply-owner.info: If an initial supply is set, this address owns it.

is-transferable.label: is transferable
is-transferable.info: Users who have a balance on this token, can transfer some or all of it to other users. In most cases users want to be able to transfer positive action tokens (e.g. for trading).

is-burnable.label: is burnable
is-burnable.info: Users can burn some or all of their balance on this token. The burned amount gets deducted from their balance and the total supply of the token shrinks by that amount.

decimals.label: Decimals
decimals.info: The digits by which your token is divisible. Zero means that users can only have natural numbers (0,1,2,3,4...) as balance on your token and only amounts in natural numbers can be transferred. Other number indicate the decimal places, e.g., "3" means the token is divisible with 0.001 being the smallest unit.

step2-design.info: The fundamental properties of this token. Defines the economic cornerstornes around this token.

step3-actions.title: Action policy
step3-actions.info: For what positive actions should users be able to obtain your new token? Take your time to think about this question. It very important for the future success for your token idea in the system. Also, it is important that users are able to prove they did the actions using the different proving methods (c.f. last section).

step4-minting.title: Minting policy

is-mintable.label: Token is mintable
is-mintable.info: Eligible users or smart contracts can "mint" any amount to a public address of their choosing. The total supply of this token gets increased by that amount.
is-mintable.hint: You set your token to not be mintable.

fin4-has-minter-role.label: Fin4 has the minter role
fin4-has-minter-role.info: To award succesfull claimers with a balance on this token, the Finance 4.0 system needs the minter role.
fin4-has-minter-role.hint: To be able to enforce a minting policy, the Finance 4.0 system needs to control the minting process. If this option is not checked you have to take care of implementing your own minting policy: by handling the ClaimApproved event from the Fin4Claiming contract or by adding an extenal underlying implementing the SuccessfulClaimNotifierInterface.

additional-minter-roles.label: Additional minter roles
additional-minter-roles.info: Additional user accounts or smart contracts that are allowed to mint this token. Be aware that your tokens claiming process might loose credibility by seeing that someone can mint the token without having to claim.

fixed-amount.label: Fixed amount
fixed-amount.info: Once the claim is successful, this fixed amount of tokens will be minted to the user. Default is 1 token per action.

variable-amount.label: Variable amount
variable-amount.info: The user chooses the amount in the moment of making a claim.

unit.label: Unit of measurement
unit.info: The unit of a claim, e.g. trees or minutes.

step4-minting.info: Minting is the default way users earn balances on positive action tokens by submitting and prooving claims.

step5-verifiers1.title: Noninteractive verifiers

verifier-to-parameterize-tooltip.label: Since this verifier has parameters to set, it will require an extra transaction when creating the token

step5-verifiers1.info: To obtain tokens, users need to prove to the system that they actually performed the action required. You can choose any combination of verifiers from the list. Please take your time to think precisely about any combination you choose. Good verifiers are suitable to the the nature of the token, suitable and practical for the users trying to obtain them, and practical for the token creators. The harder the proving is, the less users will try to obtain your token; the easier the proving is, the less perceived quality users will see in the token. In complex cases, you may want to experiment with different token designs at the same time. Finally, proving actions is a complex matter and we constantly work to improve the verifiying mechanisms.
